content.heading: C++ String Functions
paragraphs: The <string> library has many functions that allow you to perform tasks on strings.
A list of popular string functions can be found in the table below.
Learn more about strings in our C++ Strings Tutorial.
- length(): Returns the length of the string.
- substr(): Extracts a substring from the string.
- find(): Searches for a substring within the string and returns its position.
- append(): Adds a string or character to the end of the existing string.
- insert(): Inserts a substring at a specified position within the string.
- replace(): Replaces a portion of the string with another string.
- erase(): Removes a portion of the string.
- compare(): Compares two strings and returns the result.
These functions are essential for manipulating text data efficiently in C++ applications.
Understanding how to use these string operations can significantly enhance your programming capabilities.
